name: Apple Apple scab
description: Apple scab is a fungal disease causing dark, scabby lesions on apple leaves and fruit.
cure: Apply fungicides in early spring and remove infected leaves.

name: Apple Black rot
description: Black rot is a fungal disease that creates dark, sunken spots on apple fruits and leaves.
cure: Prune infected branches and use protective fungicide sprays.

name: Apple Cedar apple rust
description: Cedar apple rust causes orange spots on apple leaves and affects both apple and cedar trees.
cure: Remove nearby cedar trees and apply spring fungicides.

name: Apple healthy
description: The apple plant is healthy with no disease symptoms.
cure: Maintain proper care and regular monitoring.

name: Blueberry healthy
description: The blueberry plant is healthy and growing well.
cure: Ensure good soil, proper watering, and pest management.

name: Cherry Powdery mildew
description: Powdery mildew appears as a white, powdery coating on cherry leaves and fruit.
cure: Apply sulfur-based fungicides and prune infected parts.

name: Cherry healthy
description: The cherry plant is healthy with no visible disease symptoms.
cure: Continue proper watering, pruning, and pest control.

name: Corn Cercospora leaf spot Gray leaf spot
description: Gray leaf spot causes rectangular gray lesions on corn leaves, reducing yield.
cure: Use resistant varieties and apply fungicides if needed.

name: Corn Common rust
description: Common rust causes reddish-brown pustules on corn leaves.
cure: Plant resistant corn varieties and apply fungicides.

name: Corn Northern Leaf Blight
description: Northern Leaf Blight causes large gray-green lesions on corn leaves.
cure: Use resistant hybrids and spray fungicides early.

name: Corn healthy
description: The corn plant is healthy with strong leaf and root growth.
cure: Maintain balanced fertilization and pest prevention.

name: Grape Black rot
description: Black rot creates dark spots on grape leaves, shoots, and fruits.
cure: Prune infected parts and apply preventive fungicides.

name: Grape Esca (Black Measles)
description: Esca causes dark, scorched spots and fruit rot in grapevines.
cure: Remove infected vines and avoid pruning wounds.

name: Grape Leaf blight (Isariopsis Leaf Spot)
description: Leaf blight causes brown spots leading to reduced grape leaf health.
cure: Apply fungicides and improve vineyard hygiene.

name: Grape healthy
description: The grapevine is healthy and free from major diseases.
cure: Maintain pruning, watering, and disease monitoring.

name: Orange Haunglongbing (Citrus greening)
description: Citrus greening causes yellow shoots and misshapen fruits, transmitted by psyllids.
cure: Control psyllids and remove infected trees promptly.

name: Peach Bacterial spot
description: Bacterial spot causes dark lesions on peach leaves and fruit.
cure: Use copper bactericides and plant resistant varieties.

name: Peach healthy
description: The peach plant is healthy and thriving without disease symptoms.
cure: Practice regular orchard management and pest monitoring.

name: Bell Pepper Bacterial spot
description: Bacterial spot causes dark, wet lesions on bell pepper leaves and fruits.
cure: Use copper sprays and avoid overhead irrigation.

name: Bell Pepper healthy
description: The bell pepper plant is healthy and producing strong fruit growth.
cure: Provide good nutrition, watering, and pest prevention.

name: Potato Early blight
description: Early blight causes concentric dark spots on potato leaves and stems.
cure: Apply fungicides early and remove plant debris.

name: Potato Late blight
description: Late blight leads to water-soaked lesions and rotting potatoes.
cure: Destroy infected plants and use fungicides promptly.

name: Potato healthy
description: The potato plant is healthy with no sign of blight or pest damage.
cure: Maintain healthy soil and monitor regularly for early signs.

name: Raspberry healthy
description: The raspberry plant is healthy with vigorous leaf and fruit growth.
cure: Ensure regular watering, pruning, and pest prevention.

name: Soybean healthy
description: The soybean plant is healthy and disease-free.
cure: Maintain proper irrigation, fertilization, and field sanitation.

name: Squash Powdery mildew
description: Powdery mildew causes a white coating on squash leaves and stems.
cure: Spray with neem oil or sulfur-based fungicides.

name: Strawberry Leaf scorch
description: Leaf scorch causes dark brown spots and drying of strawberry leaves.
cure: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides.

name: Strawberry healthy
description: The strawberry plant is healthy with vibrant, disease-free growth.
cure: Ensure good watering, fertilization, and pest control.

name: Tomato Bacterial spot
description: Bacterial spot creates small, dark spots on tomato leaves and fruit.
cure: Use copper-based sprays and avoid leaf wetting.

name: Tomato Early blight
description: Early blight produces dark concentric rings on lower tomato leaves.
cure: Apply fungicides and remove infected debris.

name: Tomato Late blight
description: Late blight causes brown, water-soaked spots on tomato leaves and fruits.
cure: Use fungicides and destroy infected plants immediately.

name: Tomato Leaf Mold
description: Leaf mold appears as yellow patches and white mold under tomato leaves.
cure: Increase air circulation and apply protective fungicides.

name: Tomato Septoria leaf spot
description: Septoria leaf spot causes small, circular spots leading to leaf drop in tomatoes.
cure: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides.

name: Tomato Spider mites Two-spotted spider mite
description: Two-spotted spider mites cause stippling and leaf drying on tomato plants.
cure: Spray miticides or neem oil to reduce mite population.

name: Tomato Target Spot
description: Target spot causes brown lesions with light centers on tomato leaves and fruit.
cure: Apply fungicides early and maintain good field sanitation.

name: Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
description: Yellow Leaf Curl Virus causes curled, stunted leaves and poor tomato yield.
cure: Control whiteflies and remove infected plants.

name: Tomato Mosaic Virus
description: Tomato Mosaic Virus leads to mottled, distorted tomato leaves and poor fruiting.
cure: Use virus-free seeds and disinfect tools regularly.

name: Tomato healthy
description: The tomato plant is healthy with strong growth and no disease signs.
cure: Continue good watering, fertilization, and pest management.
